page.title: 17A Child's Sunday near Norton
page.content: On Sunday morning I got up at 8.30 a.m. I washed, dressed and went to clean my rabbits out. When I came back into the house I washed my hands and started to help Mum to do some baking because it was my brother's birthday. He was 8 and we were having a party. I made a peach trifle with brandy, some little cakes called pastry chouxs and helped Mum to make a chocolate cake, which Paul covered in Maltesers. Later we made some sandwiches and salad and lots of other good things to eat. Later in the afternoon Paul's friend Ian came to play. We all had a game of cricket on the back lawn. My uncle Tony was invited for tea but we had to wait a while because he was late. We played lots of other games but when we started to lock one another in the shed we got shouted at so I went in the living room and watched the television.
